website_summaries.verdict: A great option if you're looking for a comfortable handle design and don't need an industrial-strength tool for heavy drilling.
pros: Has an ergonomic handle with trigger for comfort and control
10 amp motor produces plenty of power
cons: The chuck is a bit wobbly and not always able to keep up with the drill's power during tough jobs

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful, but not made in USA
customer_reviews.text: I have read other reviews that had issues with the speed control. Fortunately mine has good speed control from 0 RPM up. This makes me think that the other reviewers probably had factory defective triggers/mofsets. Triggers tend to be a weak point on most prosumer power tools. I took a star off because this size drill is imported. The smaller DeWalts are USA made and I wish it was that way across the board.
customer_reviews.author: WRPSD

customer_reviews.title: Highly reccomend!
customer_reviews.text: After owning this drill for about a year now, I really don't have any complaints. I bought this to drill through the thick steel frame of my older travel trailer and I couldn't be more satisfied with how well it powered through it. I don't even bother using my cordless drill for anything bigger than a pilot hole anymore; I go straight to my tool cabinet and pull this bad-boy out for all of my other handheld drilling needs. Plenty of power and the side handle provides plenty of control. The keyed chuck works really well, holds all bits nice and tight.
customer_reviews.author: Tony N

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt DWD210G drill
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst quality built drill I’ve ever owned. The drill chuck does not hold the bit properly and the bit wobbles so violently it shakes your arms off and drills bad holes. Put the same bit in my Rigid battery drill and it spins perfectly straight and balanced. Bought this drill cause I needed a more powerful drill for a 1/2 inch auger bit through hard cherry wood. Rigid battery drill didn’t have the power even with my 9 mah battery. Paid extra for Dewalt brand thinking it was built better quality, not the case with this DWD210G drill. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D. B. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Powerful drill
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice and powerful 10A drill, but it's not a high torque drill (e.g., for large ship auger bits). I learned the difference and ended up buying a Metabo industrial drill specifically for that; it's a slower 8A drill but geared lower to keep a large bit moving in a deep hole. This Dewalt and a 1 inch spade bit will tear through any piece of lumber without even slowing down.
customer_reviews.author: Denis

customer_reviews.title: What I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Strong drill need a 10 amp to drill 1 inch holes on a tree trunk.my battery Milwaukee hammer drill burn out, but this drill went pretty well.Live tree trunk are very tough, got about 20 holes ,the drill got hot but didn’t burn down still running well.
customer_reviews.author: R.Higa

customer_reviews.title: Great drill, albeit a bit on the "weighty" side, worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for a 20 year old (and finally dead) DeWalt. This replaces a 3/8 drive. This one is a half inch bit size and the detachable handle and 10 amps will assure you of it's ability to plow through anything. It IS however, not necessarily a one- handed drill. It is heavier than most and built with industrial durability in mind. That is my only negative comment about it and I should have given more thought to the WEIGHT of the drill. That's not DeWalt's fault. I love the power of the drill. The detachable handle makes it applicable to almost any job you need a drill for. I am pretty sure this will last the rest of my life.
customer_reviews.author: DanoTop Contributor: Bob Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Works great, rugged construction, I expect it to last.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to drill any half inch holes in thick steel yet, but I did use this as a screw gun the first day to drive several hundred 3" deck screws. I have a half dozen DeWalt drills of various sizes and ages up to 25-30 years old that I use for electrical construction. I won't buy any other brand of good power tools except DeWalt and Milwaukee. They are worth the extra money. It's heavy, but the handle really helps and is easily adjusted. Lots of torque, I suspect this is the most powerful drill I have.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to bore large holes for fencing. My previous drill was not up to the task. Mind you, the holes being drilled are 2”. With disappointment, cursing and frustration with my previous drill not up to the task, I bought this one. It certainly made easy work of the task and never struggled. Although should the drill bit catch on a wood knot, you certainly will know it. Thank goodness for the secondary handle otherwise you would break your wrist. This is a very good and powerful drill and am happy to add to my trusty “go to” tools.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberley H.

customer_reviews.title: Its a Dewalt, finest drill made!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had my other dewalt drill same as this one for 15 years and it was still working but would over heat after to much use so that's why I replaced it. I'm a plumber so I have about 20 different drills most cordless but somtimes you just need the power this one gives. It's got power so you have to make sure it doesn't twist on you because it will come back hard on you. It didn't come in storage box or bag so that was disapointing but I still had the old one so I lucked out, I guess that's partially why it's so cheap for such a nice drill.
customer_reviews.author: Happy guy

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drill. You can tell the motor is powerful and of good quality just by the sound alone. It has a good balance to weight ratio, and I like the design for the removable handle. It fits into one of many slots and then pinches down so that the handle won’t move around on you while you are using it. Wayyyyy better than the Black & Decker I had and sent back because it was a weak sister. This drill cost more but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: WHITEY

customer_reviews.title: Expected better from DEWALT
customer_reviews.text: Used with Codirom Auger Drill Bit. Cons: - RPM control is too sensitive - Gears box (lower front part) getting hot in 30 sec - Drill weak. Often stuck. - Area around chuck got corroded after first use. Pros: - RPM/Speed good.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Solid Heavy Duty Drill
customer_reviews.text: Tim the Tool Man would be proud to own this drill. You can feel the drill try to turn in your hands when you pull the trigger, and the motor makes the kind of roar that only comes from raw, unadulterated POWER. This thing is a beast. I haven't had it long enough to comment on durability, but it feels like a solid replacement for my last 1/2" corded drill (a 30+ year old Craftsman) that finally bit the dust. We'll see how much 1/4" steel plate this thing can punch through over the next few decades. BTW, it definitely has a gradual start (i.e. it starts at 0 rpm, not 300 or 600 as some reviewers have indicated).
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great drill, bad packaging, stupid shipping!
customer_reviews.text: Drill is as expected, strong, heavy duty, for tough projects. Not for light duty work. Really good tool. Can't believe the shipper sent this heavy drill in just the original box which was meant for store shelf display. No damage to the tool; it is built like a tank. Surprised the product box survived at all; very minimal packaging. Should have been sent inside another box with foam or bubble wrap. Now I need a hard case for the tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful drill
customer_reviews.text: Used this to bore holes in logs for a firepit craft. 3/4" auger and 2" forstner. It handled the job in oak and maple. Best part is the locking crosshandle. Lesser models don't lock, they only tighten and they slip loose under high torque.
customer_reviews.author: RonMD

customer_reviews.title: I’d buy again
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good buy worked for me to make many hole saw cuts some were 5inch most 3inch. No issues and made some difficult work easier. I ran it for quite some time without noticing any electrical smell I’ve had in past with some weaker drills it did get hot but that’s it.
customer_reviews.author: joshua lewis

customer_reviews.title: unlike my last drill which was more like a two speed and when mixing concrete would be ...
customer_reviews.text: Powerfull and can trigger any speed, unlike my last drill which was more like a two speed and when mixing concrete would be slow or full on, slinging concrete all over. Well, that one burned up and this Dewalt is a champ. Mixes mortar bags easily and at whatever speed we want!
customer_reviews.author: Just Luck

customer_reviews.title: Great drill, Mediocre chuck
customer_reviews.text: This drill is fantastic and has tons of power, however, the chuck is difficult to tighten with the included key and slips often on drill bits with circular shanks. I'm going to look into replacing the chuck with something better.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Ogden

customer_reviews.title: Its not the workhorse I thought it was
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill believing it would be quite rugged and have a lot of torque. I needed a drill to turn 11/16 reamer bits as my 1/2” air drill can’t do it. I got about 8 holes before the drill ceased up on me. Its a good drill but if you’re looking for a real work horse in the metal industry this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: So I used it once when i first bought it to see if it worked and put it away safely in my tool shed. I try to use it today and it wont work. Isnt dewalt supposed to be a good lasting brand? Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ivan

customer_reviews.title: Impossibly durable, stronger than all my other drills despite the same amp rating
customer_reviews.text: This drill has replaced my craftsman and my enormous orange harbor freight "heavy duty" drill. The craftsman would slow down or stop when drilling tougher materials like aluminum, and the harbor freight drill would simply brake the bits with no control or throttling. With this dewalt, I don't brake bits and my drilling doesn't slow down- it just works. Excellent drill, have used it and bought another to have friends help me drill at the same time, and both have lasted years of drilling wood, aluminum, and occasionally steel. highly, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: J. Justice

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill And Powerful
customer_reviews.text: To start out the drill box itself looked like it had been through the ringer and back. As far as the product it seems to be well made. It drills with ease and is very powerful just what I needed. I am a plumber and am all the time drilling holes. I have used dewalt in the past and have been very pleased. I guess I will see how well it holds up. Another thing is that the product itself was not damaged at all, only box. Would recommend as far as now will write follow up in a few months.
customer_reviews.author: HiwayEC

customer_reviews.title: Nice and powerfull
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a product that needed a drill that had 10 amps and 1/2 inch drive. This for the $ had the power and worked as designed so far. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K. Corcoran

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt DWD210G
customer_reviews.text: Ive needed to get a cordless drill for awhile for running hole saws and the bigger spade bits that my battery operated drills dont like to run. This thing is awesome its got plenty of power from what ive used it on so far the only recomendation i have is hold on tight.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Bright

customer_reviews.title: favorite tool
customer_reviews.text: love Dewalt power tools. my most used tool was a 7.8 amp 1/2 inch corded drill. after 15 years the clutch finally went out. this one is 10 amps and no clutch. so much better. i mean this is a big boy tool, Home Improvement style. it just demands respect.
customer_reviews.author: P. C. Chinn

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy duty drill
customer_reviews.text: Powerful drive and would recommend it. I need both hands to handle the drill. Since it is a heavy duty drill, it is a little heavy for me since I am a smaller person and not strong. I just wish it would have a slower speed too.
customer_reviews.author: Member

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy construction
customer_reviews.text: The power for bigger jobs is nice. First use was for such a job in drilling 1/2 inch holes through 4" X 4" lumber. It is a bit heavy for extended use on smaller jobs (viewpoint of a small, elderly guy). Haven't use it long enough rate it tops for durability.
customer_reviews.author: Mike A

customer_reviews.title: Straight Killin Machine
customer_reviews.text: This thing is ridiculous in a good way. $120 and you get enough torque to break your wrist. Clamshell is rigid and well affixed. Metal gearbox with beefy all metal gears bathed in decent moly grease. Motor windings are epoxied at the commutator for reliably. Beefy brushes with great brass holders and springs. And a giant copper heatsink in the handle for the switch. Idk how they made any money on this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Carlson

customer_reviews.title: A must have for drilling into RR ties, using 5/8” auger bit.  See other review.
customer_reviews.text: Homeowner user with very limited skills but THIS powerful drill made making 100’s of 5/8” holes along 2 rows of over 400’ of RR ties a snap using the 5/8” auger but (see other review). The Chuck makes it snug. Powerful and made the job doeable.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Maniscalco

customer_reviews.title: One of the best for the price!
customer_reviews.text: 0-max RPM with trigger, wish it had an old fashion trigger adjustment for rpm control. VERY powerful machine, no problem drilling steel with a 5/8 bit. Great for around the shop or in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Respeto

customer_reviews.title: Nice ...
customer_reviews.text: Have only used the drill a few months, but so far exceptionally happy with it. Quality is good, love having the added handle for stability.
customer_reviews.author: TMM

customer_reviews.title: Love Dewalt products
customer_reviews.text: The chuck broke on a long kitchen install, took it the Dewalt repair shop and I was back in business within an hour with a new chuck.
customer_reviews.author: NBeauty

customer_reviews.title: Non-functioning after light use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this drill for some light renos. Used it one month in summer with no trouble. Then returned next summer to use it again and it has stopped working. Of course the return window is over so we are stuck with paying for this drill that doesn't work. If you slap it hard on the side it will run about 10 seconds then gives up again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid 120v classic drill
customer_reviews.text: Fully adjustable, solid drill. Some jobs do better with a solid heavy duty plug in drill. This drill replaced my beloved Craftsman 1-2 inch plug in which I finally killed after 25 years of solid work. This is an admirable replacement. Despite some reviews, speed is fully adjustable with no issues to date.
customer_reviews.author: I was there

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: As new. No postage required. Reduced price. Powerful drill. Has a large handle so you can hold and manage the drill with one hand with enough room to remove your finger off and away from the switch....quite unlike the 9 amp Hitachi drill where the handle is much smaller and you can't grip it w/o the finger landing on the switch. As some have said, however, even though it is termed as variable speed, it isn't. Touch the trigger even slightly and the RPMs are moving! Even so, this is a great Warehouse deal, for sure.
customer_reviews.author: DrD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drill, performs very well
customer_reviews.text: This drill was replacing one that was 25+ years old, different make. The Dewalt drill has some bulk to it, must be made with a lot of metal parts. Feels strong, and accomplished its first task quite well. Would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Wagonis

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic hammer drill.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very powerful tool and gets the job done within seconds. If you’re drilling into concrete you don’t need to use your own force. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Terrie Horta

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: This was a great buy. I have used it several times. Great to use when the job is too big for a cordless.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I've always stood by dewalt. Great brand and they don't normally ever disappoint me. Great drill, use it a lot in the shop and it has taken a beatin. Still holding up great and doesn't seem to be slowing down yet.
customer_reviews.author: Trim

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Used it the first day right out of ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Used it the first day right out of the box. I wish it came with its own hard case though. This drill has a lot of power. I drill through metal and wood on quite a few of my products. This punched right on through. I give it 5 stars. It is exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Light and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old Rockwell drill after 40 yrs. This one is lighter, easier to handle and even more powerful than my old one. Plus it is reversible and variable, two BIG pluses.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Welte

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great heavy duty drill. Satisfied let's see how long it holds up honing my engine.
customer_reviews.author: Antzack

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drill
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after my smaller drill burned out mixing mortar.used this drill to finish the job, extremely powerful, didn't even get warm while mixing the mortar
customer_reviews.author: powerby50

customer_reviews.title: POWER!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulously powerful drill. I still don't know how to put that extra arm on the front, but I haven't needed it. The instructions were not clear on how to put that on, but it is the powerful drill that I needed. It's a little on the heavy side, but worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought a Milwaukee drill of the same caliber, and it was so poorly put together that I sent it back for a refund. THIS drill, however is well made, you can see the quality in the construction. Where the M.drill felt really cheesy in its construction,this one seems really solid. I bought it for a job where I had to use a 1-3/8 inch auger through hardwood. This drill chewed through it like it was paper. I highly recommend this tool, with 10 amps of power, it can drill through anything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Amps par excellence
customer_reviews.text: Not much to add to Wayne's review. I needed a real drill for big spades and forstners and the cordless just doesn't do it; it's child's play for this thing and I don't have to put a new battery in every other hole. I've had good luck with Dewalt and so picked this over Milwaukee which would be my second choice. We're so spoiled by our battery tools but sometimes you've got to have the cord. It's interesting what $100 buys in a cordless drill - not much. As an old carpenter once told me "I buy amps".
customer_reviews.author: Laddie

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill
customer_reviews.text: Good power, good balance, and it does the job. I would buy again...
customer_reviews.author: R. Gallo

customer_reviews.title: Recent addition to my family
customer_reviews.text: The drill has a very good center of gravity with lots of power.
customer_reviews.author: A. Leonard

customer_reviews.title: drilling
customer_reviews.text: Really good drill. Only bad thing is its a plug in rather than battery.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W

customer_reviews.title: This drill means business!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to mix wet clay/plaster/slip. I thought the power of this drill was incredible. I've only used a 2amp drill, and this dominates all. The adjustable handle grip is such a plus to this product (don't over tighten it!!!!!). Figuring out how to attach the chuck to the rubber attachment was difficult, I had to google pictures to understand how to fix it on there. Other than that, this dill means business!
customer_reviews.author: A$

customer_reviews.title: Best drill i ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best drill i ever owned. Significantly more power rpms than my cordless and other corded drills I own. I bought it to drill post holes for the annual job of putting up deer fencing. This drill combined with the augur I purchased, turned a four day job into two days. Since I work, having an extra free weekend means a lot. The only thing this drill lacked was an auto clutch that apparently other drills from this manufacturer have. The times when the augur bound up on below the soil stones, the drill would rotate hard yanking my hand with it. The model with a clutch, I believe would eliminate the jolt.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Teehan Foran

customer_reviews.title: Good drill
customer_reviews.text: Last drill you’ll ever buy it’s good n heavy!! Only disappointment is it’s not available with a keyless Chuck but it’s as strong as you’d expect!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay M.

customer_reviews.title: high torque drill for serious work like driving large lag screws into 8x8 pressure treated piles ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. Big, heavy, high torque drill for serious work like driving large lag screws into 8x8 pressure treated piles or drilling access holes into concrete. Places where you *really* need that accessory torque grip. If all you need is to put 1/2: holes through soft pine lumber you would be happier with something like their 8 amp, 3/8" VSR, which I also have.
customer_reviews.author: R. White

customer_reviews.title: For now Outstanding.
customer_reviews.text: While I have not had it long I will say love everything about it. It seems really tough and was great replacement for my old burnt out drill. I wish it had come with a good container for carrying and storage. Will try to recall to update after I have had it longer and used it more.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A. Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent drill - very powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drill when we were building our home, and I have used it a lot over the past 1+ years. I have been very pleased with the quality and the power of this drill. The side handle is very solid, and is easy to adjust to a variety of angles, which is helpful in a variety of applications. I highly recommend this drill.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ripplinger

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful
customer_reviews.text: This drill is amazing. I see the trend is for battery powered drills but I wouldn't trade this for a battery drill ever. It's simple, solid and real strong.
customer_reviews.author: M Sickle

customer_reviews.title: Great Power
customer_reviews.text: I put a Cement paddle on the drill. It mixed 60 pounds like it was nothing. Make quick work out of most jobs. I could even use it for back lapping a greens mower blade. Great griping, Better then my older model.
customer_reviews.author: Macy S.

customer_reviews.title: good for price
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this drill seems good for the price. The keyed chuck closes tightly and evenly when empty. The side handle is better than Milwaukee because it tightens onto a bolt held in the non-handle side of the ring, compared to Milwaukee where the ring is tapped instead. It loses one star from me because except for the chuck, every surface on this drill is textured (or rubber) so it will be difficult to clean. This drill is made in Mexico, but Milwaukee is made in China so pick your poison.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Awesome drill. This baby is the real deal. Powerful and best used with the side handle for proper control. High level of torque powers through the tough jobs.
customer_reviews.author: ridemaster-v

customer_reviews.title: Great for drilling guide hole
customer_reviews.text: Heavy Duty. Drilling wood boards for guide hole all day long.
customer_reviews.author: SHELIA M.

customer_reviews.title: although it was a reconditioned cool was in beautiful shape although the trigger lacked the ...
customer_reviews.text: The first drill I got, although it was a reconditioned cool was in beautiful shape although the trigger lacked the sensitivity To run at the extremely low rpm's that I needed. The seller replaced it immediately and the replacement was flawless I'm totally satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Sandy T.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great tool!
customer_reviews.text: Did the job, and seems like it will last a long, long time.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Harper

customer_reviews.title: Best value
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Easy to use, powerful, and reliable. I am buying this for the second time, because the first one was stolen, so clearly I'd buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Regular Dan

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of Power
customer_reviews.text: Solid drill with power to spare. Auxiliary handle a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: beautiful beast
customer_reviews.text: Have owned and used lots and lots drill motors, but I want to put this beauty in glass and mount it on the wall, all lite up where it can be seen and enjoyed. Like a collectors gun, a commerative rifle you never shoot, or beautiful art you never want see soiled. Even with all that she is rock solid and heavy, the feel of solid confidence is inspiring.
customer_reviews.author: t49y

customer_reviews.title: Much better than my old dead Harbor Freight 1/2 inch drill.
customer_reviews.text: I have many Dewalt tools and this is another great tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful drill, good for home projects where the battery drill can't handle it. It is slower rpm than other drills, but if you are drilling big holes that is what you need. I have been drilling through 8" wood steps, 60 1" holes and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The perfect tool for piloting and screwing together wet 6x6 timbers.
customer_reviews.author: PlatypusUnicorn

customer_reviews.title: dewalt drill
customer_reviews.text: my husband loves it. He is very pleased with how well it works..
customer_reviews.author: sharon a jordan-parker

customer_reviews.title: MORE POWER THAN EXPECTED.
customer_reviews.text: THE BEST DRILL I HANE EVER BOUGHT WE ARE USEING IT TO DRILL HOLES IN RAILRAILROAD TIES WITH NO POWER PROBLEM. YOU NEED THE FRONT HANDLE OYOUR IT WOULD GET AWAY FROM YOU.GREAT DRILL.
customer_reviews.author: John Eischeid

customer_reviews.title: you want power? you got it!
customer_reviews.text: you might even say that this thing has too much power be careful when using for everyday meanial drilling tasks, you might put the srew or whatever it is straight through lol. but with great power comes great responsibility... so use responsibly ;) awesome drill!
customer_reviews.author: Ignomoly

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good 1/2" drill to use with my set of Veritas dowel cutters, and this one was exactly what I needed for the job. It is nicely smaller and a bit lighter than I had anticipated for a drill of this strength. The adjustable/removable 2nd hand-grip should be on all drills of this caliber. Recommended, for sure
customer_reviews.author: Tim Shropshire

customer_reviews.title: Great power
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Brother loves it. A little heave but steady. Lots of power
customer_reviews.author: smudge

customer_reviews.title: Good but not super powerful.
customer_reviews.text: It has more power than my crap ryobi and anchient made in us black and decker, but not the wrist snapping power I had expected.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Strong durable drill
customer_reviews.text: strong drill that has proven to be quite durable. I use it to mix my mortar, grout, and any heavy duty drilling that the cordless drills simply can't manage. It works well for these tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: It is a larger drill and it will drill very well. Don't let it get wrapped around anything it'll break your arm. Outstanding products.
customer_reviews.author: EasyRider

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this baby just yet but, I did try it and it worked ok. Thanks !
customer_reviews.author: EDUARDO TOVIAS

customer_reviews.title: Weighty and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to replace a worn out black and decker. My use for this is drilling of larger holes through thick pieces of wood and metal. The weight of this drill requires both hands to operate correctly, but it works very well with little effort. It is definitely overkill for finer work or pocket hole drilling where I use a 19.2 volt instead.
customer_reviews.author: rjrichards1

customer_reviews.title: A Great Tool.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful, light-weight enough to handle one-handed, the adjustable second handle lets you locate it where you need it, nice long cord, real-metal chuck, and drilled through tough old fir without bogging. Reversing switch is a bit flimsy compared to my cordless DeWalt, and location next to trigger makes it easy to inadvertently switch directions until you get used to it. Didn't notice the throttle tip-in issues others mentioned. Went through 12" of old wood easily and the extra handle keeps it from torqueing around. A good value from a company with a solid rep.
customer_reviews.author: blue dragon

customer_reviews.title: Great 1/2" Drill
customer_reviews.text: I have had a lot of 1/2" drills, but this is the best one I have ever had. So much power in such a nice handling, light drill. It feels like a 3/8" drill, but has awesome power for heavy drilling. The only thing I didn't like is that it comes in a cardboard box instead of a plastic carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Dirty Harry

customer_reviews.title: Soooo Happy!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband had those cartoon stars in his eyes when this package came and he opened the box. He said he always wanted a half inch drill. He really likes the handle that came with it. He was glad it came with a key chuck too. And the reverse is a plus. I'm sure he will have it a long time.
customer_reviews.author: ToniB

customer_reviews.title: Best drill ever
customer_reviews.text: Best drill I have ever owned. It's powerful and precise. Construction is solid thus I don't doubt durability. Marie's husband, Dennis
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Power!
customer_reviews.text: Love the power. For that power you must put up with the weight. The second gripper handle really helps. I bought it for mixing mortar which it does extremely well. It's also great for Forstner bits. It's a great partner for a smaller cordless drill.
customer_reviews.author: David Larrabee

customer_reviews.title: powerful
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to drill 11/16 holes thru 8 x 8 post, went thru with ease. Plenty of power and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Russell

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill
customer_reviews.text: Nice drill for the price and a well made Dewalt with high amps.
customer_reviews.author: BL

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of Power
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill in error, having entered "percussion drill" in my search on the Amazon site. This high-powered twist drill came up, and I ordered it without reading the fine print. However, it proved to have sufficient power to drill holes in my masonry walls, so I decided to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: oysters2

customer_reviews.title: Important in knowing how to read description of product.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a drill that could set different variable rpm instead of using finger pressure.
customer_reviews.author: HARRISON T. IGA

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool purchased to make log tenons. Powerful, good handle, long cord.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Fish

customer_reviews.title: bought for a retaining wall project, where i was ...
customer_reviews.text: bought for a retaining wall project, where i was drilling through 3 stacked 6x6's . Was hoping for a little more power, but i think a part of it was actually the drill bit warping.
customer_reviews.author: scott prasek

customer_reviews.title: Great Chirstmas gift
customer_reviews.text: My son would always barrow my power drill for his home projects. Now he has his own drill and I have mine back and life is good. If you need more power then a cordless, get a corded DeWalt and really attack that project. You'll win everytime.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: most power tools have a trigger lock that keeps the ...
customer_reviews.text: most power tools have a trigger lock that keeps the tool operating without holding down the trigger - this drill does not.
customer_reviews.author: Robert V

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy.
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift. After using it for a couple of months, they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Tool. But, the Drill chuck is very cheep and hard to turn to remove drill bits.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L. Murty

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Tool
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tool to drill mainly through metal/broken bolts. I already have a Dewalt 7.8amp 1/2 drill but I could not get the keyless chuck tight enough. I found this drill being sold for a very reasonable price. I like the keyed chuck and extra power. However the chuck can't grip very small bits like 1/16" Other than that, an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael N Burton

customer_reviews.title: Works great for our line of work in the carpentry industry
customer_reviews.text: Drill is very powerful. Works great for our line of work in the carpentry industry.
customer_reviews.author: Joe H

customer_reviews.title: Buy this.
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of research before I purchase any tool. This is the size, speed, torque, weight, and fit I was looking for. It works great and I will probably use it forever.
customer_reviews.author: Fozzy

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt 1/2" Drill
customer_reviews.text: Excellent drill - great torque. A real brute! Use the side handle or it will twist your wrist off! Can get heavy after a long day of use. Should have gotten the Jacobs chuck, but if changing bits a lot use a cordless....
customer_reviews.author: billsrx7

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: I'm not one to cut corners on my tools to save a little money. That's why I went with this drill. I have zero regrets on buying it. Best drill I've ever used or owned.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hudgins

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt 1/2 " pistol grip drill
customer_reviews.text: I like this drill very much. It has lots of power and will fit where my non-pistol grip drill will not. The quality of this drill seems very good and I really like the way that this movable handle works.
customer_reviews.author: Paul N

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent tool-better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I use this to mix thin set mortar-50lbs at a time. The tork is so strong I have to brace the handle against my hip to hold on. This is an excellent tool-better than I expected. I even bought one for my brother-in-law who also does tile work.
customer_reviews.author: David O'Hern

customer_reviews.title: Excellent electric driill
customer_reviews.text: Excellent electric driill. More than capable of doing the job I bought it for. Plenty of power. Variable speed works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis D. Owens

product_meta.title: DEWALT Electric Drill, Pistol-Grip, 1/2-Inch, 10-Amp (DWD210G)
product_meta.description:
Style:Pistol-Grip DrillDelivers increased drilling performance and increased overload protection for added durability. 0-1250 RPM (revolutions per minute), variable speed reversing switch for increased versatility. 980 UWO (unit watts out). 1/2" Keyed chuck for greater bit retention. 360 deg (Degree) locking side handle for greater control and versatility. Anti-slip Soft grip handle and two-finger trigger for increased comfort. Metal gear housing for jobsite durability and increased reliability. 4.9 lb. (Pound). 3 year limited warranty. This product is manufactured in Mexico. This product meets customer requirement.

AMAZON.COM
Versatile and easy to handle, the DEWALT DWD210G 1/2-Inch VSR Pistol-Grip Drill delivers the power you need for all your jobsite drilling and fastening needs. The DWD210G features variable-speed control, a convenient reversing switch, a comfortable pistol grip, and an auxiliary handle.



Patented DEWALT-Built Motor with Overload Protection
With its powerful 10 amp motor, the DEWALT 1/2-Inch VSR Pistol-Grip Drill is capable of delivering speeds of 0 to 1,200 rpm. This translates to quick, versatile drilling and driving.At the heart of this drill's performance is a patented DEWALT-built motor that generates 50 percent more power than a standard motor of the same size. It also provides increased overload protection for extended tool life.

Designed for Versatility and Durability
As versatile as it is powerful, the DWD210G functions well for both steel and wood applications. When working with a spade or auger bit in wood, it offers a 1-1/2-inch capacity, and it can handle a capacity of 2-9/16 inches when used with a self-feed unit. The drill can also handle a 1/2-inch twist bit when working with steel. When used with a hole saw, the drill offers a 3-5/8-inch capacity in wood and a 2-inch capacity in steel.

Its keyed 1/2-inch chuck grips the bit securely to prevent slippage, and a metal gear housing provides added durability.

Built with Comfortable, Accurate Handling in Mind
Comfortable handling goes a long way toward ensuring accurate results. The DWD210G is built with an ergonomic grip, and its two-finger rubber trigger makes power control easy. A locking, 360-degree, soft-grip side handle gives you hand-position options for improved user comfort and better overall command of the drill. And it weighs an easy-to-manage 4.9 pounds, decreasing user fatigue after extended use.

The DWD210G 1/2-Inch VSR Pistol-Grip Drill comes with a DEWALT warranty package that includes a three-year limited warranty, a one-year free service contract, and a 90-day money-back guarantee.

What's in the Box
DWD210G 1/2-Inch VSR Pistol Grip Drill, 360-degree locking side handle with soft grip, and chuck key with holder.







FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Pistol grip 1/2-Inch variable speed with reverse drill 10.0-Amp motor delivers increased performance 0-1200 RPM, variable-speed reversing switch for versatility. Soft grip handle and two-finger trigger provides comfort. Metal gear housing for jobsite durability and reliability.360-Degree locking side handle. Generates more power with improved overload protection for added durability.

See more
